meta.note: A buildup is a set of meterials with an associated amount. Buildups get mapped to Revit elements.
Every calculation results belongs to a snapshot.
Stores the materials that are referenced in a buildup.
Do not change material properties other than 'Amount' from here. It's gonna change materials in the Lca Materials collection.

Depending on the unit of the material use this to set the amount of material used for 1 unit of this buildup. For example:  A foundation buildup with unit 'm2' that uses 1.5m thick concrete would use "Amount = 1.5" if the unit of the concrete component is 'm3'. If it also has a continuous membrane component measured in 'm2' the amount for the membrane is 1.
This a not a relational field on purpose. This will ensure static archiving.
This a not a relational field on purpose. This will ensure static archiving.

The combined GWP for A1-A3, KgCO2e
Leave empty for generic materials. If the material is very specific to a locaiton, select the database where you got the material from.
Use something that let's you search the source db for this material. Example: Name or ID.
